title: 103_s774
content: The Act may be cited as the "King Holiday and Service Act of 1993" and establishes the Martin Luther King, Jr. Federal Holiday Commission. The Act "King Holiday and Service Act of 1993" amends the commission to include service opportunities, requires at least 3 members under 29 years old, and establishes the Chairperson of the Commission on National and Community Service. The Martin Luther King, Jr. Federal Holiday Commission is amended to include an ex officio member from the National and Community Service Act of 1990. Changes include adjusting the salary grade, funding amounts, and expanding the scope of the Act to include service opportunities. In section 9, the date of "April 20, 1994" is replaced with "until terminated by law". SEC. 168. NATIONAL SERVICE DAY is added to the National and Community Service Act of 1990, establishing a day for national service. The Commission may grant funds to eligible entities for service opportunities on Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Eligible entities include states, communities, educational institutions, and private industry councils. Applications must be submitted for consideration. The Commission consults with the Martin Luther King, Jr. Federal Holiday Commission for grant recommendations. The Federal share for activities is 30 percent. The Federal share for activities is 30 percent. The State and local share of the cost may be in cash or in kind. Definitions and reporting requirements under the Act are also amended. The text chunk discusses amendments to the ACTION Agency and the Martin Luther King, Jr. Federal Holiday Commission. It also authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 1994 through 1999 and specifies funding for section 168. Additionally, it mentions changes to the Table of Contents of the Act. Amendment to the Table of Contents of the Act by inserting a new item after section 167. "Amendment to the Table of Contents of the Act by inserting a new item after section 167. Sec. 168. National service day."
